profiles:
Experience Management and People Development Consultant Debbie Lowe Limited January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Warrington I am a passionate and dedicated Learning and Development specialist with a HR background and 20 years of experience. I specialise in leadership and management development, coaching, performance management, team building and cultural change.  
 
I have a proven track record in the diagnosis, design, delivery and evaluation of development interventions improving both individual and business performance.  
I have a pragmatic approach and draw on my own personal experience to ensure solutions meet business needs. I expertly foster great relationships with business leaders at all levels. I take time to understand customer needs to ensure development solutions are challenging and impactful. My facilitation skills consistently receive excellent customer feedback.  
 
I have experience of designing and delivering training for colleagues in China, Hong Kong and Bangladesh.  
 
I am also a qualified practitioner of the Myers Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI), the Team Management System (TMSDI) and the Insights Discovery System. Group Management Development Consultant Shop Direct Group November 2009  –  November 2013  (4 years 1 month) Shop Direct Group Debbie designed and implemented development solutions as part of establishing Shop Direct’s comprehensive leadership and management development offer, contributing to improved sales growth and an increase in colleague engagement measures. She redesigned the internal Leadership programme for high potential managers. This resulted in an improvement in leadership behaviours and KPIs in participants successfully achieving accreditation. More recently Debbie was responsible for ensuring the current portfolio of management training aligned to a new business strategy and values. •	End-to-end event management (staff Christmas parties, etc.) for 200+ employees Experience People & Development Consultant (Melbourne) Moray & Agnew August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Melbourne Area, Australia Re-hired on a fixed-term basis to provide cover.  
 
Completing similar duties and responsibilities as outlined below with more of a Melbourne office focus. 
 
Consulting at Moray & Agnew Lawyers two days a week to allow me to consult at LITTLE Real Estate for three days each week, since 29 August 2014 until 14 November 2014. People & Culture Advisor (contract role) LITTLE Real Estate May 2014  –  November 2014  (7 months) Melbourne Area, Australia - Assisitng with a large merge between Run Property and Little Residential to form LITTLE Real Estate - Australia's largest real estate business 
- Rolling out new policies, procedures, benefits and inititiatives and streamlining People & Culture processes 
- Assisting with People & Culture strategy 
- Providing all aspects of Human Resources to over 300 employees 
- Developed an employee database including 300+ employees People & Development Consultant Moray & Agnew March 2009  –  April 2014  (5 years 2 months) Moray & Agnew Lawyers Key Achievements 
 
• Significant reduction on recruitment costs through: 
- Development and roll out of the online recruitment program 
- Development of a ‘grow your own’ promotion program for Junior Secretaries 
- Reducing staff turnover by retaining high achievers 
 
• Raising the profile of the People & Development department across the firm through: 
- Efficient and receptive service 
- Improving visibility and availability for coaching and counselling 
- Providing legal and industrial relations advice on performance and contract issues 
 
• Event management: 
- Responsible for planning and coordinating the annual Christmas party for 200+ staff and similar events such as Melbourne Cup Day and End of Month Drinks 
- Assisting and supporting various client functions 
 
Reason for leaving: To re-locate back to Melbourne permanently after successfully gaining Australian Citizenship. Human Resources & Payroll Officer Experian July 2008  –  February 2009  (8 months) Melbourne Area, Australia Key Achievements 
 
• Responsible for payroll procedures: 
- Processing pay for over 150 employees each month 
- Dealing with payroll tax, PAYG tax, group certificates and superannuation 
- Producing, manipulating and analysing payroll, turnover and ratio reports 
 
• Responsible for Australian Immigration, sponsorship and visa applications: 
- Liaising with the Department of Immigration & Citizenship  
- Drafting and submitting sponsorship (457 visa) applications 
- Drafting and submitting Australian permanent residency applications 
- Organising LAFHA (living away from home allowance tax reductions) 
 
• Responsible for Work Health & Safety procedures: 
- Education/research on current WHS legislation 
- Becoming WHS representative, ergonomically testing offices and workstations for all new employees, conducting WHS checks and reporting incidents to WHS insurers 
- First aid officer and fire warden training 
 
Reason for leaving: To re-locate to Sydney. Visa restrictions at the time. Human Resources Coordinator Minter Ellison October 2007  –  June 2008  (9 months) Melbourne Area, Australia Key Achievements (Human Resources Coordinator) 
• Promoted to the position of Personal Assistant to the Human Resources Manager  
 
Key Achievements (Learning & Development Assistant) 
• Assisting with firm wide events such as the Leadership Program and the Lawyers Retreat 
 
Key Achievements (Graduate Recruitment Coordinator) 
• Providing assistance to Articled Clerk and Vacation Clerkship recruitment programs, including the coordination of clerkship offers, induction and rotations 
• Organising and coordinating recruitment fairs and liaising with local universities and law institutes 
 
Reason for leaving: Visa restrictions at the time. Human Resources Assistant North East Lincolnshire Council June 2007  –  October 2007  (5 months) Grimsby Key Achievements 
 
• Providing support, guidance and advice to managers and to school head teachers, in line with the Council’s policies and procedures 
• Managing, monitoring and developing online human resource’s initiatives and services, including updating the Council’s jobs and careers Webpages (www.nelincs.gov.uk/jobscareers) and intranet site 
• Organising and attending the Job Club initiative, aiding the local community with advice on the Council, its recruitment processes, its vacancies and giving guidance on applying for jobs 
• Designing, editing, publishing and distributing newsletters to various employees throughout the Council 
 
Reason for leaving: To re-locate to Australia. Deputy Store Manager, HR Specialist TOPSHOP TOPMAN October 2005  –  June 2007  (1 year 9 months) Grimsby Key Achievements 
 
• Opening and closing the store, cashing the tills and finalising daily/weekly banking 
• Completing necessary administration paperwork such as monitoring refunds, discounts, till overrides and staff purchases 
• Taking a leading role in the stores recruitment and selection process, followed through with the training and development of each employee, including inductions and appraisals 
 
Reason for leaving: To gain HR experience at local government HR In-Store Systems Trainer/Top Level Sales Advisor TOPSHOP TOPMAN October 2004  –  October 2005  (1 year 1 month) London, Oxford Circus (Flagship Store) Key Achievements 
 
• Heavily involved in bulk recruitment from short-listing applications to attending assessment centres and subsequent interviews 
• Organising and implementing inductions to over 25 new employees each week 
• Training and developing new employees on till training, store account cards, various store projects and career progression 
• Responsible for a store area which achieved sales of over $700,000 AUD (over ₤300,000) per week 
• Supervising and developing a team of 20+ people

Summary Da febbraio 2010 a Ottobre 2011 ho lavorato presso il Gruppo di hotel di lusso, Eleganzia Hotels & Spas come PR & Event Manager. Mi sono occupata delle relazione con la stampa nazionale attraverso un lavoro di ufficio stampa diretto, mentre a livello internazionale ho coordonato cinque agenzie PR nei mercati più importanti (UK, Russia, Germania, Francia, USA). Ho inoltre organizzato eventi di core marketing e conference stampa sia in Italia che all'estero. Inoltre durante il periodo di apertura degli hotel, curare l'esperienza dei giornalisti in struttura e fare relazioni pubbliche è stato parte integrante del mio ruolo. Prima di questa esperienza in Italia ho lavorato sette anni presso un'azienda di telecomunicazione internazionale, in Inghilterra: la BT. Nel corso di pochi anni sono stata promossa quattro volte e ho ricoperto diversi ruoli nell'area della comunicazione aziendale, della formazione e sviluppo del personale, nell' employement engagement e della finanza. Negli ultimi 3 anni mi sono specializzata nel settore della consulenza a livello di training & development, e sono stata responsabile della formazione di circa 3000 dipendenti e di un budget annuale di circa 800.000 sterline. 
Il mio ultimo ruolo, Senior Business Support manager, consisteva nello sviluppare e realizzare progetti e iniziative legate al campo delle risorse umane (selezione, promozione...), ma tali da produrre cost savings per l’azienda. Ho lavorato a diretto contatto con il CFO (Chief Financial Officer) della BT per tre anni, il che mi ha dato la possibilità di capire e osservare come le scelte decisionali e strategiche di un' azienda delle dimensioni della BT vengono fatte e portate a termine. Lavorare a stretto contatto con il senior team di dirigenti e direttori mi ha inoltre aiutato a sviluppare le mie capacità di consulenza, di presentazione e di communicazione sia parlata che scritta. Specialties:Ottima conoscenza dell'inglese parlato e scritto e del business english. 
Buona conoscenza del tedesco e spagnolo. 
Conoscenza elementare del Francese. 
Ottima conoscenza ed uso di Frontpage, internet explorer, microsoft excel, office, outlook, powerpoint, word. Summary I am an OD/People Development Consultant with over 20 years’ experience delivering results in the following functions: OD Consultancy, Coaching, Learning & Development, Leadership Development and Outplacement. My career has spanned across the public, private and not for profit sectors,  
 
I have held senior roles and delivered large scale transformation and change projects at a local, regional and national level. I have operated at strategic and operational levels of management and continued to develop my portfolio of skills demonstrating: initiative, creativity, people management, relationship management, self-awareness, communication skills and organisational awareness. 
 
At the same time, I continue to thrive on the dynamics of one to one relationships with individuals. I believe in bringing a high level of energy and enthusiasm into my role and it is great empowering individuals and organisations to realise their potential. I get a real sense of achievement when a client feels that there has been some positive impact for them. I look forward to new opportunities that facilitate clients' next challenges. Summary A human resources specialist with more than 15 years’ experience, Managing the human resources function at a national Patent Attorney and Trade Marks firm Phillips Ormonde Fitzpatrick based in the Melbourne office. 
 
I have expertise in policy development, performance management, performance counselling, workplace investigations, project management and end to end recruitment. 
 
I have also worked for more than 10 years at one of Australia's largest international legal firms, Minter Ellison, as a Human Resources Consultant, before changing occupations and moving into Project Management with the Country Fire Authority for eight years.  
 
I returned to human resources and the legal industry in 2008 as a Human Resources Consultant at Mills Oakley Lawyers, then in 2010 moved to Australian Laboratory Services as Human Resources Manager, managing the HR function across the company nationally which included laboratories in Victoria, NSW and QLD.  
 
In August 2011 I again returned to the legal industry to manage the human resources function for Holding Redlich’s Melbourne office. In July 2015 I commenced at Phillips Ormonde Fitzpatrick to Manage the Human Resources function for the firm nationally.

Summary Denise is passionate about her contribution to organisations and the people they are built upon, good leadership and staff engagement. She has a wealth of cross cultural experience, working with blue chip clients extensively across Europe, Asia-Pacific, South America, and the U.S.This accumulated and invaluable experience provides her with an impressive client portfolio that spans the industries of Banking, Engineering, Healthcare, Technology, Insurance, FMCG, Oil and Gas, Shipping and others.  
 
Denise's experience both in consultancy and working as a senior manager has grown to cover a broad spectrum of Organisational & People Development. With good business acumen her approach is practical and solution orientated.  
 
Her key strengths are her ability to form relationships with people at all levels within an organisation and her confidence to positively challenge.  
 
Experience: 
 
• Creating successful L&D teams/departments 
• Strategic OD and L&D Needs Analysis 
• Change Management 
• Business growth and direction facilitation 
• Coaching & mentoring  
• Competency based Performance Management Systems  
• Design, delivery and implementation of skills training programs for management, sales and customer service 
• Team Building 
• Talent Management & Development 
• Leadership Development 
• Employee Engagement 
• Client focus strategy development 
 
As a facilitator Denise brings a bright sense of humour to her work which helps create an open and interactive learning environment. Although participants work rigorously through her programs they also find the experience very enjoyable and the feedback she receives consistently endorses her approach. 
 
As a Senior Leader she works with the stakeholders to direct the organisation in robust development initiatives which underpin and embed the organisation's culture and support the business strategy. Experience Organisational & People Development Consultant & Owner The Creative Partnership Group PTE Ltd. August 2011  –  March 2014  (2 years 8 months) Singapore Originally founded by Denise Dahl in Europe in 1995 and then reborn in Asia The Creative Partnership worked with clients such as Unilever; Changi Airport; Morgan Stanley; Den Norsk Bank; Microsoft; Transocean; Maersk etc. in APAC to offer tailored solutions. As a boutique consultancy we provided bespoke solutions and deliveries specific to their needs. We believe that all development interventions should relate to an organisation's business issues and strategic focus. Participants are encouraged to take responsibility for their own development with the support of management. Our programmes are designed to address both behaviour and skills, are very interactive, fun and focus on practical learning that can easily be applied back in the workplace.  
Together with our network of first class facilitators, coaches and consultants across APAC, the UK, USA, Israel, India, China and Spain The Creative Partnership offered: 
 
• Change Management 
• Business growth and direction facilitation 
• One on One Coaching and Counselling for leaders based on 360 feedback.  
• Business Process Re-engineering and Process Improvement Facilitation. 
• Competency definition 
• Competency based Performance Management Systems designed and implemented 
• Organizational Development Needs Analysis 
• Team Building 
• Talent Development 
• Leadership Development 
• Employee Engagement 
• Stress Management 
• Presentation Skills 
• Client focus strategy development 
• Design and delivery of skills training programmes for management, sales and customer service 
• Train the Trainer programmes 
• Implementation and project management of training solutions Head of People Development & Communication APAC (Director) RBS Global Banking & Markets September 2010  –  July 2011  (11 months) Singapore RBS was one of my clients for 3 years. I was invited to join them as an employee to create an OPD department within the Operations business to primarily identify the causes of identified business challenges and subsequently create and deliver a strategic People Plan. In addition to this core responsibility I was accountable for staff communication and CSR activities. 
 
With only one junior direct report my key achievements were: 
• Designed and implemented a staff survey to identify the level of line management involvement with staff development/coaching 
• Created a strategic People Plan aligned to the business goals and challenges 
• Designed and implemented a ‘Coaching Culture & Performance Management ‘ strategy 
• Designed and implemented a Talent Assessment and Development program 
• Designed and developed a Client Focus Program which is now being implemented globally 
• Introduced the first pan-regional CSR fund raising event for male health 
• Introduced a Personal Development lending library in Singapore 
• Worked within the Rewards & Recognition Regional Team to evaluate and introduce new R&R initiatives 
 
In partnership with HR: 
• Updated and implemented a revised Graduate Recruitment Program 
• Created a Mobility program with full marketing launch Owner The Creative Partnership June 1995  –  August 2010  (15 years 3 months) London, United Kingdom and Oslo, Norway The Creative Partnership offered tailored solutions to help global organisations such as Morgan Stanley; The Northern Trust; RBS; Aon Insurance; Norton Healthcare; Sony Broadcast & Professional; Norwegian Police Academy etc. succeed through their people. 
This was the founding consultancy which was then reformed as The Creative Partnership PTE Ltd based in Singapore. Independent Consultant Achieve Global March 1996  –  April 1998  (2 years 2 months) I worked as an occasional independent training consultant delivering skills programmes for management, sales and customer service from Learning International, Zenger Millar and Kassett. During this time I worked in most industries in and outside of the U.K. International Organisational Development Manager Tektronix Inc September 1992  –  May 1995  (2 years 9 months) Marlow, Buckinghamshire, England Tektronix was a client for 2 years prior to being invited to join them as an employee. With minimal internal resources and funding I worked closely with operational management across Europe to design and implement a HRD strategy that met the business needs and issues of a dramatically changing company which was experiencing massive downsizing. I also found myself heavily involved in the organisation and facilitation of many BPR and process improvement activities. 
 
• facilitated and designed the process to re-engineer operational structures and processes. Starting  
• facilitated business growth and direction workshops 
• created competency based role definitions in various functions for new and existing positions, based on evolving business needs 
• through different types of needs analysis, designed, resourced and implemented development programs for employees at all levels (including a major management program based on modular attendance)

• introduced programs to improve teamwork, morale and motivation 
• introduced tools to support !'taking responsibility for your employability" which encouraged work based activities to support individuals wanting to expand their skills 
• developed technically skilled sales teams to be more client focused 
• developed sales personnel into account managers taking responsibility for accurate forecasting, planning and account development

Summary Tony is a performance focused and commercially minded HR professional with specialisms in learning and development, performance management and organisational and leadership development. He has delivered learning and development interventions at strategic and operational levels including performance improvement, leadership and soft skills development. He has also developed “fit for purpose” performance management and behavioural competency frameworks. 
 
Tony has significant stakeholder management experience at a senior level and is a seasoned communicator who has presented from Board level down and to external clients and agencies. He has an excellent track record in the delivery of projects, on time and within budget and has successfully secured government funding for business and staff development. 
 
In applying his practical experience of business consultancy and partnering, Tony has built productive working relationships at all levels. His strong organisational, problem solving, facilitation and negotiation skills have enabled him to contribute to the achievment of strategic business objectives. 
 
Tony is an enthusiastic and committed team player who is passionate about harnessing the potential of people in their job roles. Summary With great passion for Human Development, Denise has been in the Human Resources, more specifically, the Training and Development field for several years. She has encountered various industries such as IT, Telecommunications, Banking, Pharmaceutical, Food, Retail, FMCG, Real Estate, Construction and Government. With her comprehensive background in human behavior and social and group dynamics, she has helped form, strengthen and drive outstanding performance of individuals and teams from small enterprises to multinational corporations like Avon, Pfizer, Jollibee, Shangri-La, Dupont, Genting Star Cruises, Hewlett-Packard, URC and SM Supermalls just to name a few. Aside from Learning and Development, she is also well exposed in the different functions of Human Resources and as a consultant, have handled the HR Division of two premier local IT companies.  
 
Her expertise has also gone offshore when she was invited to talk about Professional Presentation Skills to a Doctor’s Conference in Malaysia. She has also appeared several times in national television as a mainstay consultant for a broadcasting network, ABS-CBN’s, entrepreneurial show Kabuhayang Swak na Swak. 
 
Specialization Areas 
Learning and Development Courses/Topics 
 
The Presence Factor: The Art and Science of Impression Management (Look, Speak and Act like a Professional) 
Communication: Business Correspondence, Presentation Skills 
HR Functions: Talent Acquisition and Development, Change Management, Coaching, Strategic HR Partnering, Group Dynamics 
Service: Customer Service Marketing, Customer Experience 
Personal Effectiveness: Stress/Time/Priority Management, Personal Balance 
Organizational Health: Vision, Mission and Values Alignment, Team Synergy 
 
-----------

During my time here I initiated OD projects e.g. in Distribution to contribute to improving it's effectiveness; Senior team Development, Coaching; Introduction of Performance management; Graduate Development scheme; Introduction of e:learning; Various training provided by myself or suppliers.  
 
I previously worked as an Organisational and Management Development Consultant with a variety of organisations for over 20 years. The last fourteen years has been with my own business.

Training design and delivery. 
 
For larger projects, I was supported by an expert team of associates.

Summary I'm passionate about developing people and organizations. I currently put that passion to work for Google as a People Development Business Partner supporting an emerging and strategic part of Google's business organization. 
 
My current role includes consulting with senior stakeholders, working with HRBP's to build and execute people plans and developing large-scale change efforts to drive sales, build great managers, leaders and teams and motivate employees to meet the challenges of working in a dynamic, competitive high-tech environment. 
 
Outside of my core job, I support Googlers as an internal coach (we call them Career Gurus). I provide guidance on a variety of work-related topics including exploring new career opportunities, navigating company culture, developing new skills, sustaining high-performance, improving communication and having more productive interactions with coworkers. Search for more info: career guru google.

Outside of my core job, I support Googlers as an internal coach (we call them Career Gurus). I provide guidance on a variety of work-related topics including exploring new career opportunities, navigating company culture, developing new skills, sustaining high-performance, improving communication and having more productive interactions with coworkers. Search for more info: career guru google.

Experience People Development Consultant Google December 2011  – Present (3 years 9 months) London, United Kingdom Team & Organizational Development Consulting  
 
My main role it to work with teams or organizations to assess team health, and consult, design & deliver interventions to increase team effectiveness. This can include work in a variety of spaces such as well being, diversity, culture change, change management. The solution could be as small as a coaching conversation with the team lead, or a long term intervention with part of the organization.  
 
I am passionate about building capacity in the in the system (aka teaching them to fish!) & as such I try to empower manages to lead the changes, I encourage individuals or teams to own their development, and I constantly think of creative solutions that can happen outside of the classroom in every day life.  
 
Additional projects:  
- 1:1 coaching with 4 internal people managers 
- Support for Diversity & Inclusion initiatives (eg designing leadership programs for women, running a number of culture change initiatives) 
- Involved in employee engagement initiatives (eg well being programs, department offsites)  
 
Skills include:  
1) Assessment & diagnosis (of team/organization challenges,in partnership with business leads, HR etc to identify opportunities, possible future states, and desired outcomes (e.g., surveys, needs assessments, interviews) 
2) Intervention Design (to create effective group dialogue and development activities as one-time sessions, as part of larger off-site meetings, or ongoing consulting engagements.  
3) Expert Facilitation (complex activities, large groups, sensitive topics, knowledge of interpersonal and group dynamics)  
4) Expertise in soft skill training such as leadership & management, communications, well being, emotional intelligence 
4) Support & Consultation (to enable & encourage the design and implementation of self-facilitated interventions) 
 
Areas of expertise/interest:  
Management & Leadership 
Employee Engagement 
Communication & Presentation Skills 
Well Being
